other_tests.findings: A large macro-AVF fed by the posterior spinal arteries of T-12 and L-1 on the left and L-2 on the right, resulting in a large venous varix within the thoracic spinal cord.
Successful obliteration of the macro-AVF, confirmed by postembolization angiography.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postembolization axial and sagittal MRI revealed reduction in size of the venous varix and resolution of spinal cord edema.

other_tests.findings: Complete resolution of T2 hyperintensity in the spinal cord; no abnormal perimedullary flow voids.
other_tests.changes_over_time: There was complete resolution of spinal cord edema, and hematosiderin deposits were noted within the residual cavity of the venous varix.
